title: Minor Chords
description: Learn to play minor chords and hear the difference between major and minor sounds.

steps.title: Major vs Minor
steps.description: Minor chords are built like major chords, but the middle note (the 3rd) is lowered by one semitone. This small change gives minor chords a sad, dark, or moody quality. Compare: C major = C-E-G, C minor = C-Eb-G.

steps.title: Play C Minor
steps.description: Play C, Eb, and G together. Notice how it sounds darker than C major.
steps.hint: C (60) + Eb (63) + G (67). Eb is the black key between D and E.

steps.title: Play A Minor
steps.description: A minor uses only white keys: A, C, E. It's one of the easiest minor chords to play.

steps.title: Play D Minor
steps.description: Play D, F, and A together to form a D minor chord.

steps.title: Play E Minor
steps.description: E minor uses E, G, B â€” all white keys. It's very common in pop and rock music.

steps.title: Compare: Play C Major
steps.description: Now play C major (C-E-G) again. Listen to the contrast with the minor chords you just played.

steps.title: Minor Chord Quiz
steps.description: How does a minor chord differ from a major chord?

quizOptions.label: The root is raised by 1 semitone
